page.title: 13Mrs Diggle's Day
page.content: One of the oldest citizens of Old Warden is 73 year old Mrs Diggle who has lived there since l936. Her house was once a vicarage. It is approximately 200 years old and stands in 14 acres of land. Her three part-time gardeners help look after the estate. Her day consists of getting up at 8.15am and and having breakfast at 9.00 am. Later she feeds her Guinea Fowl, Bantams and two donkeys then sometimes she does some gardening. She has lunch at 1 pm. She then visits friends in the afternoon. Her main meal is at 7.30 in the evening. After dinner she watches television and reads. Mrs Diggle loves Old Warde; she finds it a friendly village.
